item.description:
The Riverway Lobster House has been welcoming diners to the Bass River area of Yarmouth since 1944, when the Pazakis familly first opened it’s doors. Nearly 70 years later many things on The Cape have changed, but The Riverway remains. The Siscoe’s have successfully operated Wimpy’s Seafood Cafe & Market in Osterville since 1996. The expansion seemed to be a natural fit. Both restaurants share 70 years of history, have each had only three owners and have always been a central part of their respective communities. The Riverway offers two distinctive dining areas. The tavern offers fireside dining and plenty of televisions with a large bar to enjoy the game at. The dining room offers a variety of options and is the perfect spot for either a special occasion or a casual night out.

 

The Riverway offers a brunch menu in additon to a full lunch menu as well on Sundays.  The restaurant offers classics such as Eggs Benedict, Eggs Oscar, Omelets, and other traditional breakfast offerings. 

 

Check out the full Brunch Menu on the Riverway's web site!
